decks.notes: This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures and burn spells. By utilizing a combination of efficient low-cost creatures like Fervent Champion and Robber of the Rich, along with powerful finishers like Embercleave and Anax, Hardened in the Forge, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero. The inclusion of cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell enhances the damage output of burn spells like Frost Bite, ensuring a swift victory through constant pressure and direct damage.

This Naya Aggro deck focuses on quickly developing a wide board presence and overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and powerful combat tricks. Using efficient creatures like Jaspera Sentinel and Lovestruck Beast, along with card draw engines like Edgewall Innkeeper, the deck aims to maintain momentum and pressure the opponent. Clarion Spirit and Giant Killer provide disruption against opposing strategies, while Embercleave serves as a powerful finisher. The deck also includes some card selection with Adventurous Impulse and powerful card advantage with Showdown of the Skalds.

The deck focuses on powerful control elements to dominate the opponent, utilizing cards like Alrund's Epiphany, Shadows' Verdict, and Emergent Ultimatum to gain advantage and control the board. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad allows for additional value by blinking permanents. The deck also includes ramp and card draw to ensure consistency and the ability to cast high impact spells like Cultivate and Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the game until victory is secured.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly put pressure on the opponent by playing aggressive creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Lovestruck Beast, and Goldspan Dragon. The deck also includes disruption cards like Brazen Borrower and Disdainful Stroke to control the opponent's plays. The mana base is designed to support the three colors of Temur efficiently. The deck also includes card advantage engines like Edgewall Innkeeper and Alrund's Epiphany to ensure a steady flow of resources. The overall strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggression and disruption.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Brushfire Elemental and Questing Beast while maximizing damage output with powerful combat tricks like Embercleave. Goldspan Dragon provides additional damage and card advantage, while Robber of the Rich steals cards from the opponent. The deck also includes versatile removal in Bonecrusher Giant and Shatterskull Smashing. The mana base is optimized for consistent color access to ensure a fast and aggressive start, aiming to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize.

The focus of this deck is to use a combination of removal spells, creature threats, and card advantage engines to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By utilizing a mix of creatures with strong abilities and powerful spells, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win conditions. The diverse mana base allows for flexibility in casting spells of different colors, ensuring that the deck can adapt to different situations and opponents.

The focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive red creatures and burn spells. By utilizing cards like Fervent Champion and Bonecrusher Giant, as well as Torbran, Thane of Red Fell to increase damage output, the deck aims to attack repeatedly and efficiently. Key cards like Embercleave and Phoenix of Ash provide additional threats and ways to close out games. The inclusion of Snow-Covered Mountains allows for the use of Frost Bite and Faceless Haven to control the board and secure victory through fast and relentless aggression.

This Sultai Control deck focuses on controlling the game through removal spells and powerful creatures while utilizing the companion mechanic with Yorion, Sky Nomad. The deck includes a mix of card advantage, board wipes, ramp spells, and versatile threats like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Massacre Wurm. By generating value with Yorion's blink ability and Emergent Ultimatum, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and take control of the game. With a strong mana base and a mix of control elements, this deck aims to grind out the opponent and secure victory through its powerful cards and strategic plays.

This deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to build up a strong graveyard and activate powerful effects like Zenith Flare to deal massive amounts of damage. The main strategy is to efficiently use cards like Flourishing Fox and Drannith Stinger to deal damage while cycling through your deck, while also using Boon of the Wish-Giver to draw extra cards. This aggressive playstyle is supported by the versatility of the Pathway lands and the ability to protect your creatures with cards like Clearwater Pathway and Shredded Sails.

The main idea of this deck is to utilize low-cost creatures and spells, combined with cycling cards, to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggression. By cycling through the deck and triggering effects like Valiant Rescuer and Zenith Flare, the deck aims to deal consistent damage while maintaining card advantage. The inclusion of cards like Improbable Alliance and Irencrag Pyromancer provide additional value and synergy with the cycling strategy. Overall, the deck focuses on speed, efficiency, and leveraging cycling abilities to achieve victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's resources and disrupting their game plan through mill effects and counterspells. By utilizing cards like Ruin Crab and Merfolk Windrobber to mill the opponent's deck, combined with control spells like Drown in the Loch and Heartless Act, the deck aims to limit the opponent's options while powering up cards like Soaring Thought-Thief and Into the Story. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for additional value by recasting key creatures from the graveyard.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost creatures and powerful red spells. The creatures in the deck are meant to attack early and often, with cards like Rimrock Knight and Fervent Champion providing a quick start while cards like Torbran, Thane of Red Fell and Embercleave provide extra damage and finishing power. The deck also includes removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Frost Bite to clear the way for the aggressive creatures to get in for damage.

This Sultai Control deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while generating card advantage and powerful board presence through cards like Emergent Ultimatum and Alrund's Epiphany. By utilizing a mix of removal spells, counterspells, and card draw, the deck is able to control the game and outvalue the opponent. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion provides additional value through blinking permanents for added utility. The deck also includes powerful threats like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Valki, God of Lies to close out the game once control has been established.

The key focus of this deck is to maintain control of the board through a combination of removal spells and powerful enchantments. By ramping up mana with cards like Cultivate and Wolfwillow Haven, the deck aims to play big threats like Vorinclex, Monstrous Raider and Emergent Ultimatum. Yorion, Sky Nomad is included as a companion to provide additional value with blink effects. The deck also includes cards like Alrund's Epiphany and Elspeth's Nightmare for card advantage, while utilizing a mix of pathways and triomes for consistent mana fixing.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Brazen Borrower, and Goldspan Dragon. The deck utilizes cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Lovestruck Beast for card advantage and board presence. The Great Henge provides additional power and toughness to the creatures while also gaining life. Obosh, the Preypiercer serves as a companion to enhance the damage output of the deck. The mana base is well-balanced with pathways, triomes, and Fabled Passage to ensure smooth mana fixing for the deck's color requirements.

This deck focuses on utilizing the power of aggressive creatures in the Temur colors to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By including Obosh as a companion, you double the damage output of your odd-costed creatures, making each attack hit harder. The deck includes powerful creatures like Goldspan Dragon and Koma, Cosmos Serpent, supported by removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Spikefield Hazard. The goal is to establish a strong board presence early on and maintain pressure on the opponent, utilizing the versatility of cards like Brazen Borrower and Alrund's Epiphany to stay ahead in the game.
